title: Budget Shopping Challenge
description: You have $50 to buy groceries for the week. How do you approach this?

steps.question: You arrive at the grocery store with $50. What's your first step?

choices.text: Grab a cart and start shopping
Make a list and check prices first
Buy whatever looks good

steps.question: You find some items are more expensive than expected. What do you do?

choices.text: Buy them anyway and hope for the best
Look for cheaper alternatives or sales
Skip those items entirely

steps.question: You're at the checkout and realize you're over budget. What's your approach?

choices.text: Put back the most expensive items
Ask to borrow money from a friend
Use a credit card (even though you don't have one)

title: First Solo Transportation
description: You need to get to a new location across town. How do you plan your journey?

steps.question: How do you start planning your route?

choices.text: Ask a friend to drive you
Research public transit options online
Just start walking and figure it out

steps.question: You discover the bus route has changed. What's your next move?

choices.text: Call a rideshare service
Check for alternative routes or ask for help
Give up and go home

steps.question: You arrive at your destination 15 minutes early. What do you do?

choices.text: Find a nearby cafe to wait
Walk around and explore the area
Stand outside and wait

title: Emergency Situation
description: You're home alone and encounter an unexpected situation. How do you respond?

steps.question: You hear a strange noise in the house. What's your first reaction?

choices.text: Investigate the noise immediately
Call a parent or trusted adult
Ignore it and continue what you're doing

steps.question: You discover a small kitchen fire. What do you do?

choices.text: Try to put it out yourself
Call 911 immediately
Run outside and call for help

steps.question: The emergency is resolved. What's your next step?

choices.text: Document what happened for future reference
Forget about it and move on
Tell everyone you know about it

title: Social Conflict Resolution
description: You're in a group situation where there's disagreement. How do you handle it?

steps.question: Two friends are arguing about where to eat. What do you do?

choices.text: Stay quiet and let them figure it out
Suggest a compromise or alternative
Pick a side and join the argument

steps.question: The argument escalates. How do you respond?

choices.text: Try to mediate and calm everyone down
Leave the situation entirely
Get involved and take sides

steps.question: The conflict is resolved. What's your approach going forward?

choices.text: Suggest establishing ground rules for future decisions
Avoid similar situations in the future
Act like nothing happened

title: Time Management Challenge
description: You have multiple commitments and deadlines approaching. How do you prioritize?

steps.question: You have homework, a part-time job, and a social event all due today. What's your first step?

choices.text: Start with whatever feels easiest
Make a priority list and timeline
Try to do everything at once

steps.question: You realize you can't complete everything on time. What do you do?

choices.text: Communicate with relevant people and ask for extensions
Work through the night to finish everything
Give up on some commitments

steps.question: You successfully manage your time. What's your reflection?

choices.text: Analyze what worked and plan better for next time
Feel relieved it's over
Take on even more commitments
